isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - REMOVE - CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 5000i SERIES BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1997

svcproc.title: CAB AIR SUSPENSION system for 5000 i SERIES BEFORE SEPTEMBER 1997

warning.para: For safety purposes cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 5000 i Series before September 1997 contains two air springs (bags) (Item 1), two shock absorbers (Item 2), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 3). The air suspension assembly (Figure 118) needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air lines (to air spring) (Item 5), elbow fittings (Item 4), air springs (bags) (Item 1), height control valve (Item 3), shock absorbers (Item 2) and lateral control arm (Item 23) - should be checked at the time the vehicle is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve (Item 3), air springs (bags) (Item 1) and shock absorbers (Item 2) are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

figure.caption: Figure 118. Cab Air Suspension System for 5000 i Series before September 1997

svcprocinfo.para:
Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and air line fitting connections. Refer to the
TORQUE CHART
for (Figure 118) for proper tightening of all fasteners and air line fitting connections.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Height Control Valve

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve (Item 3, Figure 118) , it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

step1.para: Drain air from air system.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 119 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Press and hold release button against fitting body and pull push to connect connector (Item 4) and air line (supply) (Item 1) from elbow fitting in "SUPPLY" port of height control valve (Item 3).
Loosen compression nut (Item 8) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 2) from elbow fitting in "SUSP" port of height control valve (Item 3).

Remove height control valve linkage (Item 5) from threaded ball pivot (Item 24, Figure 118) by unlatching linkage clip and carefully pry the height control valve linkage socket from threaded ball pivot on height control valve arm (Item 6).

figure.caption: Figure 119. Cab Air Suspension Height Control Valve

calloutgroup.callout1: 8. COMPRESSION NUT (TIGHTEN HAND TIGHT + ONE TURN)

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 6 and 7) and remove height control valve (Item 3) from suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 8 and 9) at the left cab mount plate (Item 19) at the top of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 10 and 9) at the mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove shock absorber (Item 2) from between left cab mount plate (Item 19) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 8 and 9) at the right cab mount plate (Item 20) at the top of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 10 and 9) at the mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21) at the bottom of shock absorber (Item 2).
Remove shock absorber (Item 2) from between right cab mount plate (Item 20) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag)

step1.para: Drain air from air system.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from air system, be sure air system is drained and be sure to set parking brake and/or block vehicle wheels to prevent it from moving while service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Loosen compression nut of elbow fitting (Item 4) and pull air line (to air spring) (Item 5) from elbow fitting at the bottom of each air spring (bag) (Item 1).
Remove elbow fittings (Item 4) from both air springs (bags) (Item 1).
Remove jam nuts (Item 16) from the threaded stud at the bottom of both air springs (bags) (Item 1).
Carefully raise cab for enough clearance to remove air springs (bags) (Item 1) as follows.
Use a suitable jack placed on frame rail flange and back of cab floor frame (Figure 106) .
Once the jack is positioned properly, carefully raise cab for enough clearance to lift bottom threaded stud of both air springs (bags) (Item 1) from suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).

caution.para: Over-raising of cab may cause component damage.

step1.para: Once the cab has been raised, screw air spring (bag) (Item 1) off threaded stud on left cab mount plate (Item 19), then slide air spring (bag) from between left cab mount plate and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).

Once the cab has been raised, screw air spring (bag) (Item 1) off threaded stud on right cab mount plate (Item 20), then slide air spring (bag) from between right cab mount plate and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21).

svcsubproc.title: Remove Lateral Control Rod
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 118 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove lateral control rod (Item 23) as follows.

step2.para: Remove hex head bolt (Item 11) and hex lock nut (Item 12) from mounting bracket of suspension crossmember bracket (Item 21) and lateral control rod (Item 23).
Remove hex head bolt (Item 13) and hex lock nut (Item 12) from cab mount plate (Item 19) and lateral control rod (Item 23) and remove lateral control rod.
